setContent

public int setContent(java.lang.String key,
                      byte[] value)
Description copied from interface: Connector
Set or replace a new Value for the given key.
If set or replace a value is not possible because of a readonly Connector (e.g.: ClasspathConnector, then Constants.SETTING_NOT_POSSIBLE must be returned. If set or replace was successful, then Constants.SETTING_SUCCESS must be returned.

Specified by:
setContent in interface Connector
Parameters:
key - the Key for the configuration-property. e.g.: "com/mycompany/myapp/myParameterKey"
value - the new byte[]-Value for the given key
Returns:
Returns Constants.SETTING_SUCCESS or Constants.SETTING_NOT_POSSIBLE

clearCachedValue

public void clearCachedValue(java.lang.String key)

addConnector

public void addConnector(Connector connector)
Description copied from interface: Connector
add a Connector if you needed inside the Connector.init() Methode.
Or you can use this connectors inside the settings4j.xml to set a parameter/property 
 
 Example configuration in settings4j.xml:
 --------------------------------------
 <connector name="PropertyFileConnector" class="org.settings4j.connector.PropertyFileConnector">
     <param name="propertyFromContent" value="${connectors.content['org/settings4j/config/propertyFile.properties']}" />
     <contentResolver-ref ref="DefaultContentResolver" />
     <connector-ref ref="ClasspathConnector" />
 </connector>
 --------------------------------------

Specified by:
addConnector in interface Connector

init

public void init()
Description copied from interface: Connector
Will be called after all properties have been set. This function will only called one times.

public java.lang.String getName()
Description copied from interface: Connector
Return The name Of this Connector. The Name is required in all Settings.set*(..., String connectorName) Methods.

isReadonly

public boolean isReadonly()
Description copied from interface: Connector
Return if this Connector is read Only (or Wrapped with the ReadOnlyConnectorWrapper).
Example for some Redonly Connectors: PropertyFileConnector, ClasspathConnector

Specified by:
isReadonly in interface Connector
Returns:
if this Connector is read Only (or Wrapped with the ReadOnlyConnectorWrapper)
